name: Rustic Marinara Sauce
author: NMP
summary: I've been perfecting this recipe for over 10 years. Melting just a little cheese in the sauce adds great richness without overwhelming the tomatoes. And it's easy to keep these ingredients stocked in the house! Makes for amazing leftovers!
ingredients: 1 cup freshly grated Pecorino-Romano cheese, divided
directions: Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy pot over medium heat; cook and stir onions for 5 minutes
Add garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes more

Mix petite diced tomatoes, diced tomatoes, white wine, tomato paste, oregano, salt, sugar, black pepper, red pepper flakes, and bay leaves into onion mixture; reduce heat to low, cover Dutch oven, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until flavors blend, about 1 hour
Add 1/2 cup Pecorino-Romano cheese, basil, and parsley into into sauce; stir until cheese melts, about 5 minutes
Sprinkle remaining cheese over sauce when serving
